sentences.english: In 2004, Henan's High Court reheard the seed case.
sentences.chinese: 2004年，河南省高院重審了這個種子案。

sentences.english: But just minutes ago, Lawyer Li Li told me that the Supreme Court regulations are that verdicts can take as long as six months.
sentences.chinese: 但剛纔李立律師告訴我，高院規定的期限是六個月。

sentences.english: Taiwan's High Court said Thursday evening it is extending the detention of former leader Chen Shui-bian by 2 months.
sentences.chinese: 17日晚，臺灣高院裁定繼續延押陳水扁兩個月。

sentences.english: It indicated that this did not mean waiting until a High Court hearing next October.
sentences.chinese: 這暗示它無意等到明年10月的高院聽證會。

sentences.english: The Kentucky high court decided that in loco parentis justified that rule.
sentences.chinese: 肯塔基州高院決定家長制符合這個規則。

sentences.english: Britain argued its law didn't fall within the scope of the EU rules.
sentences.chinese: 英國高院迴應，英國法不屬於歐盟法的範圍。

sentences.english: The officer was acquitted by a higher court and had his rank restored to him.
sentences.chinese: 那位軍官被高院無罪釋放並恢復原軍銜。

sentences.english: Courts were required to submit experience tips of handling property cases to the supreme court for reference.
sentences.chinese: 並且如果有典型的物權法案例時應當提交最高院研究。

sentences.english: Will the Supreme Court's campaign finance decision damage democracy?
sentences.chinese: 高院的競選資金決定會破壞民主嗎？

sentences.english: Now it might be headed back to the Supreme Court.
sentences.chinese: 現在看來這起訴訟只能轉到最高院了。

definition: to protest against a verdict/to lodge an appeal

pinyin: Zui4 gao1 Ren2 min2 Fa3 yuan4

definition: criminal court/abbr. for 刑事法庭[xing2 shi4 fa3 ting2]
